summary: This is an email chain between FBI personnel and a paralegal regarding a victim of Jeffrey Epstein seeking reimbursement for counseling treatment. The paralegal, Maria Kelljchian, provides details of the treatment and invoices, and confirms the victim was interviewed by the FBI.

persons.name: Maria Kelljchian
persons.context: She is a Florida Registered Paralegal with Edwards Pottinger LLC, who is corresponding with the FBI to seek reimbursement for counseling treatment for an Epstein victim.

persons.name: Shelley Kavanagh
persons.context: A Licensed Clinical Social Worker (LCSW) at Oakbrook Counseling Center who provided counseling services to the Epstein victim.

persons.name: Brittany Henderson
persons.context: Copied on the email from Maria Kelljchian to the FBI regarding the victim's treatment reimbursement.

persons.name: Cardenal Edwards
persons.context: Copied on the email from Maria Kelljchian to the FBI regarding the victim's treatment reimbursement.

connections.description: Maria Kelljchian is seeking reimbursement for counseling services provided by Shelley Kavanagh to an Epstein victim.
Maria Kelljchian copied Brittany Henderson on an email to the FBI regarding victim reimbursement.
Maria Kelljchian copied Cardenal Edwards on an email to the FBI regarding victim reimbursement.

events.title: FBI meeting with victim
events.description: An Epstein victim attended a meeting with the FBI, as confirmed in the email chain.

events.title: Email request for victim treatment reimbursement
events.description: Maria Kelljchian emailed the FBI seeking reimbursement for counseling treatment paid for by an Epstein victim.

locations.address: Oakbrook Counseling Center, 4804 W. Commercial Blvd., Tamarac, FL 33319
locations.context: Location where the Epstein victim received counseling therapy.

locations.address: 425 North Andrews Avenue, Suite 2, Fort Lauderdale, Florida 33301
locations.context: Address of Edwards Pottinger LLC, the law firm where Maria Kelljchian works.

keyFacts: An Epstein victim from Florida, who lacks health insurance, paid for her own counseling treatment and is seeking reimbursement through the FBI.
The victim had previously been interviewed by the FBI, with a meeting confirmed on November 12, 2020.
Maria Kelljchian, a paralegal, submitted invoices totaling at least $900 for counseling services provided by therapist Shelley Kavanagh.
The email chain indicates an ongoing process within the FBI to approve and pay for victim-related expenses.
